FAQ.question: What exactly is a Link Document in Telangana or Andhra Pradesh?
FAQ.answer: A Link Document is the certified copy of a registered Sale Deed or related document maintained at the SRO. It proves the legal ownership and history of the property.

FAQ.question: What information do I need to provide to request a Link Document?
FAQ.answer: You will need details such as the Sub-Registrar Office (SRO), Document Number, Registration Year, and property identifiers like Survey Number, Flat Number, or Plot Number.

FAQ.question: Can I request additional property documents along with the Link Document?
FAQ.answer: Yes. You can also request Encumbrance Certificate (EC), Market Value Certificate, Mutation details, Tax Receipts, or other property-related documents.

FAQ.question: Is the Link Document valid for legal, registration, or loan-related processes?
FAQ.answer: Yes. Certified copies issued through JaaGa are sourced directly from official registries and are accepted for bank loans, court matters, verification, registration, and mutation.

FAQ.question: Is the service available across all districts in Telangana and Andhra Pradesh?
FAQ.answer: Yes. JaaGa provides Link Document services across every SRO and district in both Telangana and Andhra Pradesh.

FAQ.question: Do I need to visit any Sub-Registrar Office myself?
FAQ.answer: No. JaaGa handles the complete process on your behalf. You simply provide the required property details, and we fetch the certified document for you.

FAQ.question: How much does obtaining a Link Document cost?
FAQ.answer: Pricing varies based on document type and SRO requirements. JaaGa provides transparent charges before processing your request.
